title: HerbGarlic Crusted Flank Steak with PanRoasted Grapes
directions: Combine first 5 ingredients. Rub steak with herb mixture.
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large, heavy skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook steak 6 to 7 minutes on each side or until desired degree of doneness.
Remove and cover loosely with foil.
Reduce heat to medium. Add remaining 1 tablespoon of oil to pan, and sauté grapes and shallots 5 to 6 minutes or until grapes just begin to soften.
Remove from heat, and let stand 1 minute.
Stir in vinegar and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Slice steak against the grain into thin slices.
Arrange on a serving platter, spooning grapes and cheese over meat.
Sprinkle with additional fresh herbs if desired.
ingredients: ½ c. freshly crumbled blue cheese
